channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At the speed of judgment
item.description: Getting to the conference in Santa Fe isn’t difficult. Someone will drive/fly you there. The hard part is deciding to go. And yet, it might take 8 hou...

item.title: Long-term selfish (and the circles of us and now)
item.description: Whenever we make a choice, we do our best. We make a decision based on our interests. In other words, it’s selfish. So what makes a choice a selfish a...

item.title: When Do The Clocks Change? When Daylight Savings Time Begins In March
item.description: Clocks "spring forward" in the U.S. and Canada on March 9 and in the U.K. and Europe on March 30, 2025. Here's exactly when — and why we have Daylight...

item.title: Book Review: ‘The Infinite Retina’ (Second Edition) By Irena Cronin And Robert Scoble
item.description: 'The Infinite Retina' (2nd Ed.) explores Spatial Computing, AI, and XR’s impact on seven industries. A bold, sweeping vision—compelling, insightful, a...

item.title: Figma Link ‘Tears Of The Kingdom’ Toy Review: Just Astonishingly Good
item.description: It’s been a while since I reviewed a 'Zelda' action figure, but this new Link figma from 'Tears of the Kingdom' is exceptional.

item.title: Getting precise about tolerance
item.description: Tolerance is an engineering term. When the parts of a car are made to a low tolerance, that means that they fit perfectly. A modern Lexus is a better ...

item.title: 5,000 CAPTCHA Tests Used As Infostealer Gateways—Do Not Complete Them
item.description: As 5,000 fake “I Am Not A Robot” tests are deployed as part of a large-scale password hacking campaign, users warned: Do not complete these CAPTCHA’s.

item.title: The lonely unicorn
item.description: That’s not what usually happens. If there’s at least one unicorn in the world, it’s likely not the only one. And if one can make a valid English word ...

item.title: Northern Lights, A ‘Blood Moon’ And A Solar Eclipse: The Sky In March
item.description: All the day and night sky highlights in March 2025, including a total lunar eclipse, and a deep partial solar eclipse, and a potential peak in aurora.
